definition[0]: to reduce the amount of work, worry, debt etc that someone has
example[0]: We should hire another secretary to lighten Barbara’s workload.
definition[1]: to become brighter or less dark, or to make something brighter etc
example[1]: As the sky lightened, we were able to see where we were.
definition[2]: if you lighten something such as a mood or atmosphere, or if it lightens, it becomes less sad or serious
example[2]: Nora didn’t respond to my attempts to lighten the conversation.
definition[3]: if someone’s face or expression lightens, they begin to look more cheerful
example[3]: His whole face would lighten when anyone mentioned Nancy.
definition[4]: to reduce the weight of something, or to become less heavy
